page.title: 17WOODS MANAGEMENT, FELBRIGG
page.content: Two woodsmen are responsible for the woodland maintenance on the Felbrigg Estate. The busiest season is from November to March, after an area has been felled and cleared in the Autumn. It then has to be fenced, and young saplings planted. Spring is a period of spraying and pruning, while July to the end of August is a period of weeding young plantations. Newly-planted areas are{block-planted with oak, pine, chestnut and beech in blocks of nine. Eventually, only one tree from each block will remain. With{woodland trails}and some areas open to the public, another task is to take care of any damage. Notices have to be replaced when removed, and litter is also a problem. A little damage to young trees is also caused by 20-30 deer (other wild animals include foxes and grey squirrels).
